There’s nothing more transformative for a space than a fresh coat of paint. That being said, that very same paint can start to look a bit worse for wear over the years. Whether it’s due to scuffs from moving furniture, holes from hanging (and moving) art, or simply natural discoloration, there comes a time when you start to notice areas of your home that could benefit from a touch-up. 

Now, this is usually when you’d pull out that old can of paint (with the hope that it didn’t dry out or shift in color), grab a brush, and get to painting. But what if I told you that there was an easier way to give your walls a quick refresh that’s also mess-free and can ensure your paint will still be as good as new when you need it? Say hello to the magic that is a paint touch-up pen!

What Is the Slobproof Touch-Up Paint Pen? 

Whether you’re looking to touch up that scuffed wall, cover that hole you just patched up, or even hide that nick in your favorite piece of furniture, you can think of these paint touch up pens as your secret weapon. To prepare them, simply use one of the included syringes to transfer paint from your can to the empty pen. Then, reattach the head, twist the base to saturate the brush, and you’re ready to start painting! 

Because of its pen design, you’ll no longer have to worry about laying out your paint tarp to catch drips or spills. And the best part? These pens are refillable and airtight, too, so they’ll preserve your paint, meaning you can throw them in your drawer with the confidence that they won’t dry out for years to come.

I stored them away and just recently pulled them out and used them. Soooo very easy! The paint was still good, and they worked like advertised. I definitely recommend them!” —MM

“Have a blast touching up your scuffed walls and more! This tool is brilliant and I might add it’s addicting! Add your paint, and you’re on your way … I started in one room and found myself roaming around my entire house refreshing my walls! Best part, you can pick up the paint pen anytime and keep going. It’s therapeutic! Highly recommend!” —Kim Etzel

“Just bought a house, had the whole house painted, and as we moved in had a few scratches and dings. This product was super easy to use and made it mess-free for touch-up paint throughout the house. Best part is you just cap it and have it for future needs!” —Mary Thielemier

You can get your hands on these paint touch-up pens in your choice of either a pack of two for $14.99 or a value pack of five for $24.99. Something tells me that these pens are about to become your new home-improvement MVP.
